intro: Acnida floridana, commonly known as the Florida acnida, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing white to pale yellow blooms. Acnida floridana is often found in wetland habitats and is considered a rare species due to habitat loss and environmental changes.
